comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content: On first glance I thought it was Denis O'Brien and Seanie Fitz in the back of the carriage.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: You're not alone - thought it was Denis O'Brien! First thing I did was zoom in to check...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content:
I'm not really a bus expert, but there are at least 4 types of Dublin Bus double decker in this shot, all painted that two tone green that was introduced with the Bombardiers.
Sorry if I get their official names wrong, but here goes....
One of the late 70's Vanhool buses in foreground. These all used to be that insipid orange colour.
Just passing the Bank of Ireland is an older, late 60's Leyland bus, which is blocking a noisy Bombardier.
To the right of that is a then brand new Leyland Olympian "RH", (just looked that one up). Is it a 15A?
And beyond that is another Vanhool.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: I thought it was O'Brien too until it occured to me how unlikely it would be that he would be sitting on a cart with Seanie and the pair of them wearing red ties. Even in the '90s that pair were never communists.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Incidentally, the lad just disappearing through the door could well be me.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Yep. Lanky, slouched, red-ish hair, reebok shoes, grey denim jacket, black shirt, blue jeans. Of course, a lot of the youth of Dublin looked like that, so it could be somebody else. (shoes could also be nike, in which case it's not me).

comment.author: 27814270@N04
comment._content: Interesting looking street lamps. Do the still look the same? They really look out of place next to Trinity.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/conor_o_reilly] No, different style there now...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 27814270@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Wow, thanks! That's what I thought they looked like. These ones look like some dodgy leftovers from when they designed Belfield!
